flavor: "Amateurs feign it as 'random packet loss'. They do this for safety. They do this out of fear. But why should we cower? We will collapse the Corporatocracy, piece by piece! They are not the ones to fear. We are." - Freedom Khumalo
text:
Whenever you breach R&D, access 1 additional card.
When the Corp purges virus counters, trash this program.
title: eXer

flavor:
"It makes every bad thing that you do so much better."
- g00ru
text: Whenever you trash a Corp card, you may place 1 virus counter on Friday Chip. When your turn begins, you may move 1 hosted virus counter to a virus program.
title: Friday Chip

flavor: The smell of rot strengthens with each step.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, you may place 1 virus counter on Crypt. [click], [trash], 3 hosted virus counters: Search your stack for a virus program and install it (paying its install cost), then shuffle your stack.
title: Crypt

flavor: You'd think someone would have noticed a program entitled "Career Opportunities in Hacking" earlier.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first time you install a card each turn, the Corp loses 1[credit].
title: Corporate "Grant"

text: The first time you would take any number of tags or suffer any amount of net damage each turn, you may trash No One Home to force the Corp to "Trace[0]. If unsuccessful, the Runner avoids any number of tags or prevents any amount of net damage."
title: No One Home

text: Make a run on a remote server. When the run ends, gain [click] and add Marathon to your grip instead of trashing it if the run was successful. You may not make another run on that server for the remainder of this turn.
title: Marathon

flavor: Ripples are all the prey sees before Gbahali swallows it whole.
text: [trash]: Break the last subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.
title: Gbahali

text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Force the Corp to "Trace[3]. If unsuccessful, reveal all cards in HQ. The Runner may choose up to 2 of the revealed cards. Shuffle those cards into R&D."
title: White Hat

text: When your turn begins, you may trace[X], where X is equal to the number of hosted power counters. If successful, do 1 core damage and trash this asset. If unsuccessful, place 1 power counter on this asset.
title: Kuwinda K4H1U3

flavor: Every level of protection for all of your security needs.
text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [subroutine] Draw up to X cards. [subroutine] Add up to X cards from Archives to HQ. [subroutine] Shuffle up to X cards from HQ into R&D.
title: NEXT Sapphire

text:
Whenever an encounter with this ice ends, if the Runner did not fully break it, do 3 net damage.
[subroutine] Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] You may draw 1 card. The Runner may pay 2[credit] to draw 1 card.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Anansi

text: Whenever the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you may trash this upgrade. If you do, the Runner must approach that ice again. They may jack out.
title: Code Replicator

text:
Choose one:
  • Purge virus counters. Trash 1 card from the top of the stack for every 3 virus counters removed.
  • Gain 2[credit].
title: Reverse Infection

text: When your turn ends, you may name a card type. Gain 2[credit] the first time each turn the Runner plays or installs a card that has the type you last named this way.
title: Azmari EdTech: Shaping the Future

flavor:
Master any subject in 30 minutes or less!*
*Azmari EdTech is not responsible for altered memories or reduced temporal lobe functionality. Level of mastery may vary.
text: As an additional cost to steal Degree Mill, the Runner must shuffle 2 installed Runner cards into the stack.
title: Degree Mill

flavor: "Welcome to Azmari Mail! You have 4,196 unread messages."
text: When your turn begins, the Runner draws 1 card. You may gain 1[credit] for every 2 cards in the grip.
title: Personalized Portal

flavor: "The way I see it, you've got two options: die here or die running. I'll enjoy both."
text: When you score Armed Intimidation, the Runner must either suffer 5 meat damage or take 2 tags.
title: Armed Intimidation

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Whenever the Runner installs a card or trashes an installed card, you may gain 1[credit].
title: Death and Taxes

text:
Play only if the Runner accessed a card during their last turn.
Trace[4]. If successful, trash 1 installed program with an install cost of X or less, where X is equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.
title: Trojan Horse

text: The install cost of each program, piece of hardware, and virtual resource is increased by 1. Whenever the Runner installs a program, piece of hardware, or virtual resource, you may gain 1[credit].
title: TechnoCo
